title: Lordstown Motors' New Interim CFO Known for Turning Around Struggling Companies
summary: Electric truck startup hires an outside advisory firm to manage its finances. Lordstown Motors Corp. hired an outside advisory firm to handle its finances, raising questions about what is ahead for the electric truck startup that last week warned investors it lacks sufficient cash.

title: Biden, Erdogan Meet in Attempt to Reset U.S.-Turkey Ties
summary: The longtime allies' relationship has deteriorated in recent years over issues spanning human rights, Middle East conflicts and military alignment. ISTANBUL-President Biden met with Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan for the first time since taking office, as the two NATO allies attempt to repair a frayed relationship by seeking common cause over their security interests across the world, from Libya to Syria and Afghanistan.

title: Need Help Remembering Life Before Covid? Head to Vermont
summary: Resume Subscription. FAIRFAX, Vt.-Last week, a group of senior citizens who attend Rev. Elizabeth Griffin's strength training class in a former church did something that felt radical. They had class without their masks.

title: After Apple Subpoenas, Justice Department Rethinks Policies on Getting Lawmakers' Records
summary: Merrick Garland launches review after revelations of secret subpoenas served by agency under Trump. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department will bolster its procedures for obtaining records from members of Congress, Attorney General Merrick Garland said Monday, after it emerged that the agency during the Trump administration secretly seized data on the communications of Democrats on the House Intelligence Committee.

title: The Tin Can Sailors of World War II
summary: James Hornfischer, the historian who chronicled these naval heroes, dies at 55.. James D. Hornfischer, a historian of the U.S. Navy, died June 2 at 55. The costs borne by Navy sailors in World War II seldom receive prime billing in history courses, but amid so much fresh attention on the Pacific, more Americans should thumb through Hornfischer's work about the Navy's "finest hour," off the coast of Samar on an October morning in 1944.

title: Leaving Afghan Allies Behind
summary: Abandoning translators to the Taliban is a moral and strategic mistake.. The U.S. Embassy in Kabul suspended visa operations on Sunday, citing rising Covid-19 cases in Afghanistan. Now it's up to the White House to do more for the Afghans in mortal danger as they wait for visas.

title: The Making of an Electric-Vehicle Fiasco
summary: Free credit, taxpayer EV subsidies, and political cheerleading.. Yield-hungry investors have been driving headlong into SPACs (special-purpose acquisition companies), and some are now getting burned. Witness the trouble at electric-truck manufacturer Lordstown Motors , which may be a canary in the supposed SPAC gold mine.

title: The SEC Takes on Retail Traders
summary: Its review of trading platforms could slow the trend toward lower costs.. If you're one of millions of Americans trading stocks with zero commission, you have Gary Gensler's sympathy. The new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission wants to restrict the business model that has made trading cheaper and more accessible than ever.

title: Mississippi's People Should Choose Its Abortion Laws
summary: When I face the Supreme Court, I will seek to vindicate democratic principles.. Jackson, Miss.

title: The Pay Is Generous, the Work Nonexistent
summary: The federal unemployment bonus was a bad idea to begin with. It needs to go-immediately.. The latest Labor Department statistics show an all-time record 9.3 million unfilled jobs, even though more than nine million Americans remain unemployed. Alarm bells should be ringing in Washington.

title: Senate Confirms Jackson for Powerful Appeals Court
summary: Judge Jackson is seen as a candidate for a future Supreme Court vacancy. WASHINGTON-The Senate on Monday confirmed one of President Biden's most prominent judicial nominees, Ketanji Brown Jackson, for the appeals-court seat that Merrick Garland long held before becoming attorney general.

title: Bitcoin Rises Above $40,000 on Elon Musk Tweet, MicroStrategy Plans
summary: The cryptocurrency jumped as MicroStrategy completed a bond offering allowing it to buy more bitcoin. Bitcoin reached its highest level in more than two weeks Monday, buoyed by MicroStrategy Inc. completing its $500 million offering of junk bonds to buy bitcoin and by fresh comments from Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Elon Musk.

title: To Understand Joe Manchin, Look at West Virginia's Transformation
summary: Bipartisanship is required for Democrat holding on in a state that has shifted so solidly from blue to red. In the 1996 election, Democrat Bill Clinton carried West Virginia by 15 percentage points in the presidential race. Democrat Jay Rockefeller was re-elected to his Senate seat with a stunning 77% of the vote. Democrats won all three of the state's House seats.

title: 'My Place at the Table' Review: An Appetite for Paris
summary: When he was hired as a food writer, his boss said, 'If it doesn't work out . . . I'll ﬁre you.' He then unwittingly panned the boss's favorite bistro.. In 1986, Alexander Lobrano was offered a job writing for Women's Wear Daily and W magazine in Paris. He accepted at once. No matter that he didn't know a thing about his assigned beat, men's fashion. John Fairchild, the much-feared publisher, told him not to worry. "If it doesn't work out, that's easy. I'll fire you."

title: Stop Blaming Kamala Harris
summary: It's not her fault she has no good answers about the border. It's President Biden's.. Kamala Harris has been home almost a week now from her first foreign trip as vice president. Even so, the political class is still feasting off the disaster that her two-day visit to Guatemala and Mexico became.

title: While Democracies Lecture, Their Adversaries Run Free
summary: Team Biden confuses stern statements with progress on China, Russia and Iran.. As President Biden travels across Europe from one summit to the next, the memory of Donald Trump's disruption is starting to fade, and the soothing pageantry of diplomacy is resuming its stately course. The familiar rituals are back. In Cornwall, England, meetings were held, communiqués were composed, and all was harmony and light, with the exception of intra-European squabbles over the rules governing sausage shipments from the mainland of Great Britain to Northern Ireland. More of the same is expected in Brussels. America is back, the West is back, multilateralism is back, and all is well.

title: The Rising Stakes for the Fed
summary: The risks to its credibility and independence are growing.. The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) convenes this week for a regular meeting that carries more than the usual stakes. Chairman Jerome Powell and colleagues need to decide soon whether to defend the Federal Reserve's credibility and independence. Otherwise they may find they've missed their opportunity.

title: Nicaraguan President Defies U.S. in Harsh Crackdown on Opposition
summary: Daniel Ortega tightens his grip ahead of November elections, as rivals are arrested; 'we are worried, nervous and afraid'. Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega, 75, who is running for a fourth consecutive term, has launched a broad campaign of repression since early June aimed at decimating the opposition ahead of November elections, according to analysts, human-rights activists and Western governments.

title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Rise to Records
summary: Investors' rotation into technology and other growth stocks advances. U.S. stocks rose into Monday's closing bell, pushing the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite to fresh records.

title: Bitcoin on the Balance Sheet Is an Accounting Headache for Tesla, Others
summary: Tesla and other companies that hold the notoriously volatile cryptocurrency often must record impairment charges when its value falls. Elon Musk reignited his curious Twitter relationship with bitcoin on Sunday, giving the cryptocurrency a small boost.

title: What Happened to the Broadway Bailout?
summary: Another case study in federal incompetence.. On Friday this column noted the predictable result that after lawmakers and central bankers initiated a multitrillion-dollar flood of Covid-related cash, various observers are advancing massive estimates of the amount of money ending up in criminal hands. But it's important to note that the problem with government wealth redistributions is not just that huge sums stick to undeserving fingers. Such programs can also fail to offer timely assistance to the very people they are intended to help.

title: SEC Considers Changes to Trump-Era Rules
summary: The SEC said it would look at amending rules related to its whistleblower award program and an anticorruption provision passed last year over opposition by its Democratic members. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said it would consider changes to regulations passed under the Trump administration, a move that drew criticism from its Republican commissioners.

title: 'Hall of Fame' by Polo G Review: A Rapper's MVP Dreams
summary: The Chicago artist continues to grow on his excellent third album, which features the hit 'Rapstar' and guests like DaBaby, Young Thug and Nicki Minaj..

title: Nuclear Firm Flags Performance Issue at Chinese Plant
summary: EDF seeks board meeting with Chinese managers of Taishan plant to get more information on gas buildup in one reactor. French power giant Électricité de France SA said it had requested an extraordinary board meeting with Chinese managers of a nuclear plant it co-owns in Southeast China to get more information on the buildup of gases inside one of the plant's reactors.

title: SEC Hires Boston College Professor as Top Corporate Regulator
summary: Renee Jones of Boston College will oversee unit regulating public company disclosures, including IPO filings. WASHINGTON-The Securities and Exchange Commission said it had hired Renee Jones, a Boston College law professor, as its top staff regulator of public companies.

title: Biden, NATO Stress Threats From China and Russia
summary: Meeting comes two days before president is due to meet Russian leader Vladimir Putin in Geneva. BRUSSELS-President Biden and NATO allies warned about China's global influence and called Russia a threat to European and Atlantic security, as the U.S. leader sought to marshal democratic nations against autocracies and bolster an alliance jolted by broadsides from his predecessor.

title: Biden and Putin to Meet, With Relations at Post-Cold War Low
summary: Summit between the U.S. and Russian leaders is unlikely to produce a thaw in the relationship, with each side looking to project strength. GENEVA-With U.S.-Russian relations at a post-Cold War low, Wednesday's summit between President Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin is gearing up to be a showdown between two leaders who have long been at odds.

title: Keep a Wide Berth (Tuesday Crossword, June 15)
Supreme Court Unanimously Draws Limit on Drug-Sentencing Relief Law
summary: Justices hold that 2018 law provides no relief to offenders whose crimes don't carry mandatory minimum sentences. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court limited the scope of a 2018 law aimed at reducing sentencing disparities for drug offenses, ruling unanimously on Monday that it provides no relief to offenders convicted of crimes that don't carry mandatory minimum sentences.

title: Illinois Chemical-Plant Fire Spurs Evacuation
summary: Owner of Chemtool facility says it doesn't know what caused blaze. Officials in the village of Rockton, Ill., near the Wisconsin border, have called for the evacuation of residents within a mile of a fire that broke out Monday morning at a chemical plant.

title: Philips Recalls Millions of CPAP, Ventilator Machines
summary: Company says sound-damping foam in breathing devices could degrade and be inhaled. Royal Philips NV has recalled millions of sleep apnea and ventilator machines over concerns that a type of foam used in the devices could degrade and release harmful, possibly cancer-causing, particles.

title: The Surprising Good News on How Menopause Changes Your Brain
summary: Menopause's effects on the brain are often temporary, according to a new study. But there's a caution for women at risk of Alzheimer's.. Menopause changes women's brains-but many of the changes are temporary, and the brain eventually compensates for some of them, according to new research.

title: New York City Ticker-Tape Parade to Honor Covid-19 Front-Line Workers
summary: De Blasio sets July 7 as date for event along Lower Broadway. New York City will honor what Mayor Bill de Blasio called "the heroes of the fight against Covid," from healthcare professionals to bodega workers, with a ticker-tape parade on July 7.

title: Trial of Scientist Accused of Hiding China Work Goes to Jury
summary: Case highlights federal law enforcement's difficulties relying on universities to police cross-border research. KNOXVILLE, TENN.-The trial of a former University of Tennessee scientist accused of concealing his work in China is highlighting the difficulties federal agents have had relying on universities to police international collaborations.

title: Vaccines Offer Significant Protection Against Covid-19 Delta Variant, U.K. Analysis Shows
summary: Public Health England says Pfizer shot 96% effective against hospitalization, and AstraZeneca shot 92% effective. Public health officials in the U.K. say they are increasingly confident that vaccines offer significant protection against the Delta variant of coronavirus, a hopeful sign as the highly transmissible strain spreads across the world.

title: Centene Settles With States Over Pharmacy Benefits Practice
summary: Managed-care company establishes $1.1 billion reserve related to talks with other states. Centene Corp. said it settled claims from Ohio and Mississippi related to its pharmacy-benefit billing practices, and it is setting aside $1.1 billion to resolve similar issues with other states.

title: Robert Redford's Utah Horse Ranch Hits the Market for $4.9 Million
summary: Resume Subscription. Actor and director Robert Redford, who turned an area of north-central Utah into a ski and lifestyle empire, is selling a 30-acre horse ranch nearby that was informally named after his 1998 movie "The Horse Whisperer."

title: Canada Files Terrorism Charges in Fatal Hit-and-Run Case
summary: In addition to first-degree murder and attempted murder charges, prosecutors allege the deaths of four members of a Muslim family constitute terrorism offenses. OTTAWA-Canadian prosecutors said Monday they would pursue terrorism-related charges against a 20-year-old man who police allege used a pickup truck to plow down a family, killing four members, because of their Muslim faith.

title: Rapid Spread of Delta Coronavirus Variant Delays U.K.'s Full Reopening
summary: Four-week holdup will allow time to assess whether rising caseloads will translate into higher hospitalizations and deaths. LONDON-U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson delayed a long-awaited end to Covid-19 restrictions in England following an upswing in cases of a more contagious variant of coronavirus, highlighting how the virus can spread even within highly vaccinated populations.

title: Robert Redford's 'Horse Whisper Ranch' in Utah
summary: About 16 miles from Sundance, this 30-acre property was purchased by the actor and director in 1996.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: One Family's Lessons Learned From a Decade of Caregiving
summary: Resume Subscription. Nick Clement, 78, spent the last 10 years caring for his wife, Lucy, who had a progressive dementia called Lewy body as well as Alzheimer's.

title: Tech Talent Migrates to Collaboration Startups as Hybrid Work Comes Into Its Own
summary: Top engineers at big-name Silicon Valley companies are moving to startups that address the work arrangements cobbled together in the pandemic. Demand is taking off. Executives at some of the world's largest technology firms are leaving prime jobs to join startups that build communications and collaboration tools, a market expected to skyrocket as more businesses settle into hybrid work arrangements.

title: Science, Groupthink and a Wuhan Lab Leak
summary: Neither the original source of the virus nor the intermediary animal has been traced to confirm the zoonotic spread.. Regarding Steven Quay and Richard Muller's "The Science Suggests a Wuhan Lab Leak" (op-ed, June 7): It has been 18 months since the pandemic broke out. Neither the original source of the virus nor the intermediary animal has been traced to confirm the zoonotic spread. For all these months, the Chinese have had the means to find out. In the absence of confirmation of a proof favoring the natural-origin theory, the lab-leak theory is gaining traction. The presence of the double CGG sequence is definitely building scientific circumstantial evidence for the lab-leak theory. The Chinese government will certainly do everything in its power to cover up. A document or a whistleblower might emerge sooner or later, if the world really seeks this.

title: Novavax Covid-19 Vaccine Is 90% Effective in Key Study
summary: Authorization of the two-dose vaccine is months away, however, as Novavax readies manufacturing. An experimental Covid-19 vaccine from Novavax Inc. was 90.4% effective at preventing symptomatic disease in adults in a large clinical trial, the company said, results that move the shot a step closer to global use.

title: Latino Voters and the Complexity of History
summary: Latinos quietly understand that world history has often been brutal and messy, yet we must recognize misdeeds and aspire toward "the better angels of our nature" if we are to build a better America.. William McGurn rightly points out that Latinos' "ethic of faith and family and work" naturally aligns them more with conservatives and Republicans rather than liberals and Democrats ("Latinos Bid Democrats 'Adios'," Main Street, June 8). The latter groups have member politicians who express disdain for religion and the nuclear family, and think people should receive monthly checks on the taxpayer's dime whether they choose to work or not.

title: Why the Irish Will Agree to Higher Business Taxes
summary: Ireland will soon enough be perfectly content with the proposed 15% minimum rate.. Regarding your editorial "Ireland's Tax Lesson for Biden" (May 28) and the letters of June 7: Ireland's experience using an aggressively low corporate tax rate to attract foreign investment has helped deliver impressive gains in per capita income (similarly in the European Union's other main tax haven, Luxembourg) but offers no real lesson for much larger, highly dynamic open economies like the U.S.

title: Tribalism, Like Wokeism, Is Corrosive to Our Society
summary: The uproar itself is an exercise in tribalism.. It was with great sadness that I read that the editors of the "Journal of Hospital Medicine" ("Notable & Quotable: Tribalism," June 5) found it necessary to bow to the language police and apologize for the use of the term "tribalism," which they now have been dutifully instructed is a "microaggression" and a "colonial construct" that ignores "the complex and dynamic identities of Native American, African, and other Indigenous peoples and the history of their oppression."

title: H.R. 1 Sounds Good but Is a Malign Federal Power Grab
summary: Rep. Allred's letter in defense of H.R. 1 conveniently omits the bill's deliberate thwarting of reasonable efforts to maintain the integrity of elections.. Rep. Colin Allred's June 11 letter in defense of H.R 1 is a pitiful and misleading characterization of this legislation. It conveniently omits the bill's deliberate thwarting of reasonable efforts to maintain the integrity of elections: its destruction of voter-ID laws, the new barriers to cleaning voter rolls of dead and relocated people, and ballot harvesting, among other issues.

title: University Vaccine Mandates Violate Medical Ethics
summary: College students aren't guinea pigs.. Some 450 U.S. colleges and universities-including our institutions-have announced policies mandating that all students be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 before the fall semester, with some requiring vaccination now for the summer term. Schools have for decades required vaccination against infectious diseases, but these mandates are unprecedented-and unethical. Never before have colleges insisted that students or employees receive an experimental vaccine as a condition of attendance or employment.

title: Jeffrey Toobin, the '1619 Project' and the Journalistic Reign of Error
summary: As long as you further the narrative, no bad behavior or corruption of the truth will go unrewarded.. If it's true that to err is human and to forgive divine, then the people who control our media must be the gods they believe themselves to be.

title: Covid-19 Punctures Narendra Modi's Aura as Some Supporters Sour on India's Leader
summary: Even some who have supported the prime minister in the past say the government could have done more to prepare and help those in need of healthcare; 'He could have prevented this crisis,' said one former backer. NEW DELHI-Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his brand of Hindu nationalist politics have weathered plenty of upheaval in India. His demonetization policy, which pulled almost 90% of the country's currency out of circulation, led to long lines at ATMs and job losses. An overhaul of the agricultural sector sparked monthslong protests by farmers.

title: Israel's New Prime Minister: Who Is Naftali Bennett?
summary: A new government ends Benjamin Netanyahu's 12-year run in power and faces a series of challenges, domestic and foreign. A new Israeli government led by Naftali Bennett was sworn in Sunday after it won a vote of confidence in parliament, ending Benjamin Netanyahu's 12-year run in power in a political shake-up that comes amid security and economic crises.

title: Lordstown Motors May Be Running Into a Dead End
summary: Electric-vehicle startups that follow Tesla down the luxury route could have better chances of success. Lordstown Motors likely won't be the only electric vehicle company to veer off the road before it has even started selling its key product. The startups that stand the best chance of meeting high investor expectations may be those focused on luxury, not utility.

title: Americans Keep Cars Longer, as Vehicle Age Hits 12 Years
summary: Cars remain in service longer as quality improves, prices rise. The average age of vehicles on U.S. roadways rose to a record 12.1 years last year, as lofty prices and improved quality prompt owners to hold on to their cars longer.

title: Supreme Court Seeks Biden Administration Views on Harvard Admissions Policies
summary: The high court is weighing whether to hear a legal challenge alleging the school discriminated against Asian-American applicants. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court asked the Biden administration to weigh in on a legal challenge to Harvard University's race-conscious undergraduate admissions policies.

title: Americans Plead Guilty to Role in Carlos Ghosn Escape
summary: Michael and Peter Taylor accused by Japanese authorities of helping former Nissan chief out of Japan on private jet. TOKYO-Americans Michael Taylor and Peter Taylor pleaded guilty to the charge of helping former Nissan Motor Co. chief Carlos Ghosn escape Japan in a box-an idea that Japanese prosecutors said Mr. Ghosn himself suggested.

title: NY Fed May Consumer Survey Finds Public Bracing for Large Inflation Gains
summary: Consumers expect inflation to hit 4% one year from now, a series high for the New York Fed report. Americans are bracing for a wave of higher inflation over the next year, amid projections of big increases in home prices, rent, food, gasoline and medical costs, the May New York Fed Survey of Consumer Expectations reported Monday.

title: New York Republicans Hope Public Safety Will Give Them Edge in Mayoral Race
summary: Democrats outnumber GOP voters about 6 to 1, but Republican candidates think people will cross party lines over recent crime wave. Two longtime New York City fixtures are enmeshed in a hotly contested primary fight for the Republican nomination in the race to succeed Mayor Bill de Blasio, a Democrat.

title: The New York Islanders Make a Final Run at Their Old Home
summary: The revived NHL stalwarts are back in the Stanley Cup semifinals-at old Nassau Coliseum-as they prepare to occupy a new arena adjacent to Belmont Park. ELMONT, N.Y.-There's a certain mystique that comes with moving to Brooklyn, but the borough isn't for everyone. The New York Islanders learned this the hard way.

title: Pandemic Hangover: $11 Trillion in Corporate Debt
summary: Resume Subscription. Before the pandemic, U.S. companies were borrowing heavily at low interest rates. When Covid-19 lockdowns triggered a recession, they didn't pull back. They borrowed even more and soon paid even less.

title: Snowflake Sees Sun a Long Way Out
summary: Cloud software provider gives a very long-term forecast that was already priced in. For all the criticism about Wall Street's short-term focus, sometimes investors do manage to think in the very long term.

title: Jill Biden Presses for School Funding, Visits Military Families and Meets the Queen
summary: First lady wades into policy issues more than some of her predecessors, with initiatives that emphasize reopening schools safely and supporting military families. SALT LAKE CITY-First lady Jill Biden used a recent appearance at a Utah middle school to call for more education spending and to emphasize safely reopening schools in the pandemic, points she says she repeatedly makes to her husband.

title: Novavax, AMC, Orphazyme, Corsair Gaming: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Futures suggest the S&P 500 would be muted after the open. Novavax shares got a shot in the arm from positive results for its Covid-19 vaccine. Bitcoin took another leg higher over the weekend after Elon Musk again took to Twitter . Here's what we're watching as Monday's trading activity heats up.

title: Biden Administration Sees a Fresh Start in Israel's Bennett
summary: To defuse tension over Iran and other policy disagreements, U.S. administration will quickly engage with Israel's fragile new government, U.S. official says. It took only two hours for President Biden, in Europe on his first overseas trip, to call Naftali Bennett after he was sworn in Sunday as the new prime minister of Israel.

title: NYPD Targets Midtown Crime Increase With Patrols, Blockades
summary: Resume Subscription. The New York Police Department has set up a mobile command post and increased patrols in the heart of Midtown Manhattan following a surge in robberies, assaults and shootings along a corridor popular with tourists and office workers.

title: MJ Rodriguez on the End of 'Pose' and Why She Never Drinks Coffee
summary: "I'm a lot of energy. I try my best not to show it, but if I have some coffee it will be a problematic situation. Cartwheels, backflips, all of the things.". MJ Rodrigeuz wasn't sure if she was going to have another mainstream role after starring as Blanca on the FX series Pose. "When Pose happened, let's be real, [I was] a trans girl coming into the industry, not knowing how she's going to fit in, not knowing how people are going to see her," she says. But now, the actress, 30, is taking on a number of new projects, including playing a nonprofit executive who works for Maya Rudolph, an absent billionaire boss, in Rudolph's not-yet-titled Apple TV+ series. Rodriguez, who has previously starred in musicals, also just released her first single, a joyous summer anthem called "Something to Say," which she performed live at the Outloud: Raising Voices x Stonewall Day concert in Los Angeles to kick off Pride Month. She's reading a lot of scripts and working on a comic book, too. "My insecurities were proven wrong by the universe, and now things are happening," she says.

title: Nike Super Spikes Are So Fast, Rivals Are Wearing Them
summary: Its track shoes are helping set records, spawning similar models and prompting other brands to let their own runners wear the swoosh in the U.S. Olympic trials or risk lagging behind. The shoe-technology revolution Nike unleashed on the marathon-running world five years ago with mysterious prototypes has veered onto the track, where a growing army of "super spikes" from the swoosh and other brands is shredding records.

title: China Clouds Biden's Transatlantic Reunion
summary: As Washington rebuilds its old-world alliances, differences over how to deal with Beijing remain a challenge with no obvious resolution. Of all the differences between the U.S. and its allies in Europe, how to deal with China is the most intractable.

title: As More Migrants Are Allowed Into U.S., Aid Groups Decide Who Can Cross
summary: The Biden administration is letting thousands enter each month to request asylum, despite the official border closure. TIJUANA, MEXICO-The U.S. government is letting hundreds of people enter the country each day to request asylum under a new plan that relies on aid groups to choose who can cross the border.

title: Companies Push Employees to Prove They Are Vaccinated
summary: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley are among employers requesting staffers to disclose vaccination status as more offices reopen. Companies are stepping up the pressure on workers to get vaccinated-not necessarily with mandates but with strong nudges.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi's Trial Begins in Myanmar After February Coup
summary: Authorities have charged the deposed civilian leader with several criminal offenses that could prevent her from returning to public life if she is convicted. SINGAPORE-The trial of Aung San Suu Kyi, whose government was ousted in a military coup in Myanmar, began Monday on a series of criminal charges that could, if she is convicted, prevent her from returning to public life.

title: Companies Spend Big on ESG Investments, Hoping for Long-Term Payoff
summary: Utilities and vehicle makers are spending heavily on efforts to reduce emissions; Philip Morris bets on smoke-free products. Companies are racking up hefty bills as they invest in new facilities and products to reduce emissions or meet other targets, hoping for a payoff down the road.

title: Boeing and Airbus Meet New Competition: Their Own Used Planes
summary: While the price of older used jets has stabilized, modern wide-body models keep getting cheaper. This may force plane makers to discount more aggressively.. It is hard to compete against your own products.

title: Investors Crave More of Payments Company Stripe
summary: Shopify, Sequoia Capital and others recently bought about $1 billion of shares in fintech Stripe, which could go public late this year or next. Stripe Inc. has yet to go public, but investors are still craving a piece of it.

title: Debt Burden Swells as Europe Extends Life Support for Companies
summary: Resume Subscription. Rousselle Industrie SA, a maker of machinery for paint manufacturers in northern France, almost collapsed in 2020 after the pandemic disrupted supply and its clients' businesses.

title: Global Ad Spending Expected to Rebound Faster Than Previously Forecast
summary: Spending in 2021 is expected to jump 19%, pushed by a 26% jolt in digital ads, according to a GroupM report. And roughly half of all spending will be concentrated at a handful of online behemoths. After a reversal last year, global ad spending is forecast to snap back from the pandemic even faster than previously predicted, GroupM said in its latest forecast.

title: Biden Tries to Rally G-7 Leaders to Challenge China
summary: Leaders also vowed to donate one billion Covid-19 vaccine doses to poorer nations over the next year. CARBIS BAY, England-Leaders of the Group of Seven wealthy democracies called on China to respect human rights but stopped short of an outright condemnation of Beijing, as President Biden sought to build momentum for an international coalition to counter Chinese influence in the world.

title: Commentary: Caution-Bullwhip Effect Ahead
summary: Companies that are rushing to rebuild their pandemic-hit supply chains risk falling into a business trap that can lead to crashing profit margins and create excess inventories. Even though global supply chains are regaining their footing as the Covid-19 pandemic begins to ease in much of the industrialized world, recent data suggests that many businesses are about to be knocked off their feet again.

title: Grocery Courier Boxed to Go Public in SPAC Deal
summary: Delivery companies are pursuing new customers as pandemic-fueled sales growth cools. Grocery courier Boxed Inc. said it would go public through a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company, or SPAC, capitalizing on delivery demand that swelled during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Oil Hits Pandemic High as Investors Bet on Green Energy
summary: Wall Street's preference for renewables could mean oil producers will now struggle to meet demand. Some investors are wagering that Wall Street's preference for green energy will depress spending on oil extraction, setting the stage for supply shortages and higher fuel prices.

title: U.S. Fight Against Chinese 5G Shifts From Threats to Incentives
summary: Washington is organizing workshops and offering a handbook to help governments avoid using Huawei, ZTE gear. The U.S. government is ratcheting up pressure on Beijing's 5G ambitions overseas, offering financial incentives and other enticements to countries willing to shun Chinese-made telecom gear.

title: Fed Could Pencil In Earlier Rate Increase at Meeting
summary: Quarterly economic forecasts are likely to project significantly higher inflation and growth than Fed officials expected in March. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve officials could signal this week that they anticipate raising interest rates sooner than previously expected following a spate of high inflation readings.

title: Covid-19 Visa Backlogs, Travel Curbs Strain Businesses
summary: Resume Subscription. Danish executive Mads Ryder recently quit his post as chief executive of fine-china manufacturer Lenox Corp., after tiring of international travel restrictions that hampered travel between his company in the U.S. and his family in Europe.

title: The Best Sports Sunglasses for Cycling, Running and More
summary: Sweat-resistant. High-performance. Our top picks to stay on your face and help keep you cool through the hottest runs and steepest biking trails this summer.. PRO CYCLIST Payson McElveen, 28, never leaves home without two biking accessories: his helmet and, for less obvious reasons, his specialized sport sunglasses. Whether bombing down a mountain, leaning into turns or ducking to avoid malevolent branches, the Durango, Colo., resident needs his sunnies to stay firmly on his face to block glare and shield his eyes from debris. And he knows his favorite poolside Wayfarers can't begin to suffice. "The field of view is much greater, which makes reading the terrain easier," Mr. McElveen said of the athlete-friendly design.

title: Buzzwords (Monday Crossword, June 14)
Ned Beatty, Character Actor Known for 'Network,' Dies at 83
summary: The Oscar-nominated actor also had roles in 'Deliverance' and 'Superman'; Credits include more than 150 movies and TV shows. NEW YORK-Ned Beatty, the Oscar-nominated character actor who in half a century of American movies, including "Deliverance," "Network" and "Superman," was a booming, indelible presence in even the smallest parts, has died. He was 83.

title: Done Working From Home? Prepare for More Hot Desks
summary: As employees return to the office, more of them will find that they no longer have an assigned workspace that's all theirs-here's how to navigate the changes. Sarah Vanunu started a new job three weeks ago at MyHeritage, an online genealogy platform based in Or Yehuda, Israel, and thanks to Israel's speedy vaccine rollout, she has been eligible for in-person work since she began. But she only goes in on Mondays and Wednesdays and leaves nothing on her assigned desk in between, since different people work there the other days of the week.
